roleset.name: Explanation offered to obtain foregiveness, justify
roleset.note: Roleset based on instances in BOLT p01, part 4. This is etymologically, but no longer syntactically related to the verb excuse.01. WordSketch provides no indication that "excuse" is ever used in the sense expressed by verb excuse: to relieve from responsibility, etc.

example.name: Args 1, 2 within LVC
example.text: I also have to wonder about the excuse *ICH*-3 made for the Dems voting for this [that they had to do it to look strong on security]-3.
example.arg: for the Dems voting for this
*ICH*-3 ([that they had to do it to look strong on security]-3.)

example.name: Nominal, Args 0, 1, 3
example.text: I spoke with one of the women he had an affair with and his excuse to her for why he couldn't visit her was that his dad had died and he had to go to his funeral.
example.note: Arg 2 is present, but outside of noun relation's domain of locality.
example.arg: for why he couldn't visit her
